title: X Factor's Nicole Scherzinger shares her two secrets to looking Schamazing

TV star Nicole Scherzinger believes the secret of looking tremendous is eau so simple...exercise and drink lots and lots of water.

Giving lifestyle tips to fans, the X Factor judge, 41, said she stayed in shape by “dragging her ass off the sofa”.

She explained she made the effort to go to a cycling class the day after flying in from Texas: “I didn’t want to do it at the time but I knew it would make me feel better.

“I’m so lucky to live the life I do but sometimes it’s hard to drag my ass off the sofa.”

She also advised: “Drink lots of water” and added: “Have plenty of sleep.”

Nicole goes to treadmill classes at celebrity gym Barry’s Bootcamp and in the past has spoken about the need to mix things up.

She told Woman’s Health: “In a workout I would run on the treadmill for 20 minutes, then some squats, sit-ups on the exercise ball, some yoga stretches.”

She added: “Me and my girlfriends support each other so when you go [to the gym] you push each other – we try to do different things.

“We’ll go hiking one day and then we’ll try a sculpting hot yoga class, then we’ll do a cardio. We motivate each other.”

Nicole will be back on ITV on Saturday night as the celebrity version of X Factor reaches the live stages.

She said: “It’s going to be insane. To be totally honest, I don’t know what viewers can expect. That’s the fun of it.

“It’s live telly. People are gonna be surprised.”

Nicole, who has the Overs category, said she won’t hold back from criticising celebs even though many have never had professional singing lessons.

She insisted: “I’m gonna tell you when something is Schamazing or when it's shiitake mushrooms. I’m here to win. I’m relying on the Great British Public to vote my acts through.

“The show feels fresh this year, and the studio is so cool!”

Earlier this week, Nicole took news host Martin Bashir from her Overs category to dinner.

Martin, 56, said: “I’ve only been singing for about four weeks and it’s very tempting to concentrate solely on the lyrics and hitting the right notes.

“But Nicole was very clear, over dinner, how to sell a song.

“She correctly observed I was terrified at Mr Cowell’s house and gave clear directions on how I need to work at my perfor­­­­mance. Her guidance has been invaluable.”

X Factor: Celebrity, ITV Saturday night, 8.20pm.
